definitions: the establishment of a relationship or link with someone based on shared feelings, interests, or experiences

examples.text: we were friendly to each other, but there was no bonding
family bonding can be accomplished by planning a fishing trip

shortDefinitions: establishment of relationship or link with someone

definitions: the action of joining things securely by means of adhesive, heat, or pressure or by chemical bonds

examples.text: the bonding of metals to non-metals
the interactions are stabilized by hydrogen bonding
scientific principles such as chemical bonding or the workings of jet propulsion

definitions: the laying of bricks in an overlapping pattern so as to form a strong structure

examples.text: the bonding of the brickwork would have to be altered during construction to allow a window to be inserted

shortDefinitions: laying of bricks in overlapping pattern

definitions: the placement of dutiable goods in bond

examples.text: they want the introduction of bonding to guarantee that consignments will be properly handled

shortDefinitions: placement of dutiable goods in bond

definitions: having the function of joining things securely, especially by means of an adhesive substance, heat, or pressure
shortDefinitions: having function of joining things securely

definitions: having the function or effect of establishing a relationship or link with someone based on shared feelings, interests, or experiences

examples.text: these can be bonding times for the whole family

shortDefinitions: establishing relationship or link with someone
